article.headline: Kennesaw State beats Chattanooga 75-69
article.story: KENNESAW, Ga. -- Yonel Brown scored a career-high 32 points and shot 18 of 21 free throws on Saturday to lead Kennesaw State over Chattanooga 75-69 for the Owls' third straight win. Nigel Pruitt scored 10 points, Nate Rucker grabbed 10 rebounds, and the Owls (3-4) shot 77.3 percent from the free throw line on 34-of-44 shooting. Brown scored 27 in the final 20 minutes, with 13 coming at the free throw line. Casey Jones led the Mocs (3-4) with 22 points and Ronrico White added 10. The Owls jumped to an 18-6 lead, but the teams were tied at 26 at halftime. Chattanooga had scoring droughts during both halves, including 6-plus minutes in the second half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
